mutants.name: L166P
mutants.Description in input context: L166P, a mutant DJ-1 found in Parkinson's disease patients

mutants.name: M26I
mutants.Description in input context: M26I, a mutant DJ-1 found in Parkinson's disease patients

mutants.name: R98Q
mutants.Description in input context: R98Q, a mutant DJ-1 found in Parkinson's disease patients

mutants.name: D149A
mutants.Description in input context: D149A, a mutant DJ-1 found in Parkinson's disease patients

variants.Description in input context: all of the mutants except for L166P made homodimers
M26I and L166P, both of which are derived from homozygous mutations of the DJ-1 gene, were unstable
their stabilities were recovered, in part, in the presence of proteasome inhibitor, MG132
all of the mutants had no activity to scavenge even endogenously producing reactive oxygen species
these cell lines also showed that all of the mutants had reduced activities to eliminate exogenously added H 2 O 2
except for that of D149A, these activities were parallel to those preventing H 2 O 2 -induced cell death
